newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: LITHUANIA-CABINET FAILS TO DECIDE BUTINGE CREDITS.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIA-CABINET FAILS TO DECIDE BUTINGE CREDITS.

text.p: The Lithuanian government failed to decide on Wednesday on issuing state guarantee for credits to finance building the Butinge oil terminal.
"The cabinet did not approve the decision on Butinge oil terminal today," the government's press office told Reuters but declined to give any details before the meeting was over.

The commission for state guarantees backed earlier this month a plan to issue state quarantees up to $200 million for the project and suggested the government to submitt the draft proposal for parliament's approval in emergency way.
Potential investors, including the Union Bank of Switzerland, U.S. EXIM, Bank of Tokyo, offered around $260 million in credits for the project but wanted state guarantees.
The construction price of Butinge is seen at $267 million, of which $65 million will come from the Lithuanian side.
